item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

Credz to Weibs for his Canvas tut which although I knew all of those things when I tried your examples it worked =]

and Yakman because I’m gonna try and make a game in SCAR =]

[code]program IsometricCubeDrawer;

var
Canvas: TCanvas;
Tx, Ty: Integer;

const //Don’t stuff with these if you don’t know Isometric drawings
BaseHorizontal = 400;
CLength = 100; //length in MM of one edge of the cube
PenColour = 16777215; //Don’t choose black…

type
Degree = LongInt;
MilliMetre = LongInt;

procedure ClearDebugWindow(Width, Height: Integer);
begin
Canvas.Brush.Style := bsSolid;
Canvas.Brush.Color := clBlack;
Canvas.Pen.Color := clBlack;
Canvas.Rectangle(0, 0, Height, Width);
end;

function Cose(Angle: Degree): Extended;
begin
Result := Cos(Angle * Pi / 180);
end;

function Sine(Angle: Degree): Extended;
begin
Result := Sin(Angle * Pi / 180);
end;

procedure Radial(var Tx, Ty: Integer; Sx, Sy: Integer; Length: MilliMetre; Angle: Degree);
begin
Tx := Round(Length * Sine(Angle)) + Sx;
Ty := Round(-Length * Cose(Angle)) + Sy;
end;

begin
DisplayDebugIMGWindow(499, 499); //So it has a middle point
Canvas := GetDebugCanvas;
ClearDebugWindow(500, 500);
with Canvas do
begin
Pen.Color := PenColour;
//Draws right 30 degree from base
MoveTo(250, BaseHorizontal);
Radial(Tx, Ty, 250, BaseHorizontal, CLength, 60);
LineTo(Tx, Ty);
//Draws right Horizontal upwards
MoveTo(Tx, Ty);
Radial(Tx, Ty, Tx, Ty, CLength, 0);
LineTo(Tx, Ty);
//Draws right —> left 30 downwards
MoveTo(Tx, Ty);
Radial(Tx, Ty, Tx, Ty, CLength, -120);
LineTo(Tx, Ty);
//Draws right —> left 30 upwards
MoveTo(Tx, Ty);
Radial(Tx, Ty, Tx, Ty, CLength, -60);
LineTo(Tx, Ty);
//Draws upwards from middle
MoveTo(250, BaseHorizontal);
Radial(Tx, Ty, 250, BaseHorizontal, CLength, 0);
LineTo(Tx, Ty);
//Draws left 30 degree from base
MoveTo(250, BaseHorizontal);
Radial(Tx, Ty, 250, BaseHorizontal, CLength, -60);
LineTo(Tx, Ty);
//Draws left Horizontal Upwards
MoveTo(Tx, Ty);
Radial(Tx, Ty, Tx, Ty, CLength, 0);
LineTo(Tx, Ty);
//Draws left —> right 30 upwards
MoveTo(Tx, Ty);
Radial(Tx, Ty, Tx, Ty, CLength, 60);
LineTo(Tx, Ty);
//Draws left —> right 30 downwards
MoveTo(Tx, Ty);
Radial(Tx, Ty, Tx, Ty, CLength, 120);
LineTo(Tx, Ty);
end;
end.[/code]

and this one draws the lines slower so you can watch it =]

[code]program IsometricCubeDrawer;

var
Canvas: TCanvas;
Sx, Sy, Tx, Ty: Integer;

const //Don’t stuff with these if you don’t know Isometric drawings
BaseHorizontal = 400;
CLength = 100; //length in MM of one edge of the cube
PenColour = 16777215; //Don’t choose black…

type
Degree = Extended;
MilliMetre = LongInt;

procedure ClearDebugWindow(Width, Height: Integer);
begin
with GetDebugCanvas do
begin
Brush.Style := bsSolid;
Brush.Color := clBlack;
Pen.Color := clBlack;
Rectangle(0, 0, Height, Width);
end;
end;

function Cose(Angle: Degree): Extended;
begin
Result := Cos(Angle * Pi / 180);
end;

function Sine(Angle: Degree): Extended;
begin
Result := Sin(Angle * Pi / 180);
end;

procedure Radial(var Tx, Ty: Integer; Sx, Sy: Integer; Length: MilliMetre; Angle: Degree);
begin
Tx := Round(Length * Sine(Angle)) + Sx;
Ty := Round(-Length * Cose(Angle)) + Sy;
end;

function Opp(X1, X2: Integer): Integer;
begin
Result := X2 - X1;
end;

function Adj(Y1, Y2: Integer): Integer;
begin
Result := Y2 - Y1;
end;

{
Some
Old - Sine = Opposite over Adjacent
Hags

Cant
Always - Cosine = Adjacent over Hypotenuse
Hide

Their
Old - Tanjent = Opposite over Adjacent
Age
}

function Hyp(X1, Y1, X2, Y2: Integer): Integer;
var
T, P: Extended;
begin
T := Opp(X1, X2);
P := Adj(Y1, Y2);
T := Sqr(T);
P := Sqr§;
Result := Round(Sqrt(T + P));
end;

procedure LineFromSlow(Sx, Sy, Ex, Ey: Integer; Angle: Degree; Canvas: TCanvas);
var
T, M, X, Y: Integer;
begin
Canvas.MoveTo(Sx, Sy);
M := Hyp(Sx, Sy, Ex, Ey);
for T := 1 to M do
with Canvas do
begin
Radial(X, Y, Sx, Sy, T, Angle);
LineTo(X, Y);
end;
end;

begin
DisplayDebugIMGWindow(499, 499); //So it has a middle point
Canvas := GetDebugCanvas;
ClearDebugWindow(499, 499);
Canvas.Pen.Color := PenColour;
//Draws right 30 degree from base
Radial(Tx, Ty, 250, BaseHorizontal, CLength, 60);
LineFromSlow(250, BaseHorizontal, Tx, Ty, 60, Canvas);
//Draws right Horizontal upwards
Radial(Sx, Sy, Tx, Ty, CLength, 0);
LineFromSlow(Tx, Ty, Sx, Sy, 0, Canvas);
//Draws right —> left 30 downwards
Radial(Tx, Ty, Sx, Sy, CLength, -120);
LineFromSlow(Sx, Sy, Tx, Ty, -120, Canvas);
//Draws right —> left 30 upwards
Radial(Sx, Sy, Tx, Ty, CLength, -60);
LineFromSlow(Tx, Ty, Sx, Sy, -60, Canvas);
//Draws upwards from middle
Radial(Tx, Ty, 250, BaseHorizontal, CLength, 0);
LineFromSlow(250, BaseHorizontal, Tx, Ty, 0, Canvas);
//Draws left 30 degree from base
Radial(Tx, Ty, 250, BaseHorizontal, CLength, -60);
LineFromSlow(250, BaseHorizontal, Tx, Ty, -60, Canvas);
//Draws left Horizontal Upwards
Radial(Sx, Sy, Tx, Ty, CLength, 0);
LineFromSlow(Tx, Ty, Sx, Sy, 0, Canvas);
//Draws left —> right 30 upwards
Radial(Tx, Ty, Sx, Sy, CLength, 60);
LineFromSlow(Sx, Sy, Tx, Ty, 60, Canvas);
//Draws left —> right 30 downwards
Radial(Sx, Sy, Tx, Ty, CLength, 120);
LineFromSlow(Tx, Ty, Sx, Sy, 120, Canvas);
end.[/code]

Yup yup, I’m not gonna fail CAD!

I know it’s very low tech and kinda useless, but its nifty =]

And I’ll make more better things as I learn more about drawing…I’m started to become obsessed with forms >_<
